Package com.team1.Auber

Class Operative

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
      • com.team1.Auber.Operative
  • public class Operative
extends com.badlogic.gdx.scenes.scene2d.Actor
    Creates an operative that goes to the systems and attacks them. It will also fight the player if attacked.
    Author:
    Adam Wiegand (Team 4), Bogdan Bodnariu-Lescinschi (Team 4), Harry Smith (Team 1 - Implement Difficulty, Operative Abilities)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      boolean dead
      is this operative dead?
      static AuberGame game  
      static GridGraph pathfinder  
      static int remainingOpers
      The number of remaining operative that are alive
      java.lang.Integer specialAbilityID
      The special ability that this operative has Set later when creating the operative 0 - No Ability (Default) 1 - Armoured Operative (Increased health, Dark Grey character) 2 - High Strength (More damage when attacking player, Dark Orange character) 3 - High Speed (Moves faster, Blue character)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Operative

        public Operative​(int x,
                 int y,
                 MapRenderer map,
                 HUD hud,
                 java.lang.Integer difficulty,
                 java.lang.Integer specialAbilityID,
                 GameScreen screen)
        Create the operative at starting point
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the starting position
        y - The Y coordinate of the starting position
        map - The map
        hud - the HUD
        difficulty - The difficulty of the game
        specialAbilityID - - This operative's special ability, if required. 0 = No ability.
